duties_responsibilities.duty: Performing maintenance, trouble shooting, and installation of chiller equipment for commercial, industrial, and institutional markets.
Coaching and mentoring branch technicians to ensure customer satisfaction and operational compliance.
Executing contract maintenance visits, inspections, and site assessments for customer equipment.
Establishing and maintaining positive relationships with customers, vendors, and co-workers through effective oral and written communication.
Providing quote estimates for labor and material repairs, and coaching and mentoring other HVAC Mechanics in quoting.

Serving as the direct customer contact for servicing products and equipment, ensuring customer satisfaction by identifying, analyzing, diagnosing, and repairing equipment and systems at customer locations.
Enforcing safety standards and maintaining security and accountability of company issued and procured assets.
Working as part of a team dedicated to delivering the highest standard of service to all customers, including flexibility to work overtime and weekends as required.
Participating in on-call rotation since the company operates 24/7.

education_certification.credential: Universal Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Systems CFC Certification.
Experience/factory training on various Water and Air cooled Chillers with emphasis on York, Carrier, Trane, and Daikin.
Operating knowledge of Microsoft office software and working proficiency with hand-held computer (i.e., Smartphone, iPad)
Good verbal and written communication skills and ability to lead a team of 6-12 Mechanics.
Ability to be on call nights and weekends on a Four-to-six-week cycle rotating basis.

More than 5 years of commercial, industrial, and/or institutional experience with all types of HVAC systems, various compressor technologies, HVAC control systems, and speed drives as well as leadership experience in managing small technical teams.
Equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer.
